medical_history.chief_complaint: Disabling hot flushes following an attempt to discontinue hormone replacement therapy (HRT).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began intensifying after she attempted to taper off HRT, leading to numerous hot flushes daily, sometimes as often as every 30 minutes. These hot flushes disrupt her sleep and have progressively made her feel increasingly uncomfortable.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy for refractory endometriosis; multiple breast cysts requiring aspiration and an excisional biopsy of a benign left breast mass; atrial fibrillation treated with nodal ablation; superficial phlebitis one year ago. No history of venous thromboembolic events.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had rectal cancer at age 70; maternal grandmother died of breast cancer in her 50s; younger sister diagnosed with breast cancer in her late 30s; father died of an abdominal aortic aneurysm. No family history of osteoporosis or premature coronary heart disease.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke or drink alcohol; exercises several times a week; lives alone; recently widowed; has a strong support network.
